Description: Flint hand-axe, roughly flaked on all edges, worked both sides.
Curator's comments: Found with a group of flints in a pocket of ash with animal bone scraps within settlement debris. Considered Tasian by Brunton and called a rough flint.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 11; pl. 28.104)
